These naturally occurring components are thought to help the body process the milk more efficiently and may even offer some protection against pathogens.

The key is proper hygiene, clean milking practices, and responsible sourcing.

In summary, raw milk is often considered safer and healthier by those who believe in its natural benefits and when consumed responsibly. It retains more of the milk’s original nutritional value and can offer unique health advantages that pasteurized milk simply does not provide.
